name: Sigma
tagline: Private web chat using Node.js and WebSocket
body:
### Welcome to Sigma.
Sigma is the easiest way to create a multi-user, one-on-one chat server using Node.js and WebSocket. Think Omegle, but less horny-teenagery and more open-sourcey. Sigma can be run with the included front end, or just a backend so that you are free to design your own UI. Sigma is super easy to install, with only one dependency:

```
$ npm install
$ node server.js
```

You may want to edit `server.js` before running it so that you can change the port it runs on.

### Demo
http://ovalbit.github.io/sigma/demo/

### Authors and Contributors
Sigma was authored by Benedict Lewis. So far, no one else has contributed.

### Found a bug?
Sorry about that. Just open a new issue, or feel free to fork Sigma, fix it, and then submit a pull request and I will get it integrated as soon as possible (promise!).

### Support or Contact
Having trouble? Contact benedict@ovalbit.com and I'll see what I can do.
